com.qtplaf.library.ai.neural

Class Network

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.qtplaf.library.ai.neural.Network

  • public class Network
extends java.lang.Object
    Feed forward neural network.

    All weights and related matrices are [rows=output, columns=input].

    This network version does not accept context layers.

    Author:
    Miquel Sas

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Network.Backward
      Data generated during the back propagation.
      static class  Network.Forward
      Data generated when the network processes inputs in a feed forward, composed of: Signals or weighted sums of inputs.

      private static double flatSpot
      Flat spot to avoid near zero derivatives in the back propagation process.

      List of sizes of each layer.

      • backward

        public static void backward(Network network,
                            Network.Forward forward,
                            Network.Backward backward,
                            double[] networkDeltas)
        Backward process of the network deltas or errors and produce the backward data, cumulating gradients.
        Parameters:
        network - The network.
        forward - The forward data generated in the forward process.
        backward - The backward data (gradients are cumulated)
        networkDeltas - The network deltas or errors.

        Returns:

      • createStructure

        public void createStructure(int... sizes)
        Creates an empty structure with the argument list of layer sizes. Weights and biases are left to zero, and activations are null. This method is intended for IO purposes to initialize the structure to later be filled with raw data.

        This version creates only neurons of types Input, Hidden and Output.

        Parameters:
        sizes - The list of layer sizes.

      • createStructure

        private void createStructure(int sizeOut,
                             int sizeIn)
        Creates an empty structure for a layer.
        Parameters:
        sizeOut - Output size.
        sizeIn - Input size.

      • addLayer

        public void addLayer(int neurons)
        Add the input layer.
        Parameters:
        neurons - The number of neurons.

      • addLayer

        public void addLayer(int neurons,
                     Activation activation,
                     double bias)
        Add subsequent layers with the given number of neurons, the same activation function for each neuron, and the same bias for each neuron. The output layer is the last layer added.
        Parameters:
        neurons - The number of neurons.
        activation - The activation function.
        bias - The bias.
